Hi,

  when installing eclipse in a common directory for all users, e.g. /opt/eclipse
and starting it with -data ~/workspace it is basically possible to use eclipse
in a multi-user environment. The problem is when starting the pde the following
error occurs:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:909)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:768)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:432)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:24)
Caused by: org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: The platform metadata area
could not be written: /opt/eclipse/runtime-workspace/.metadata.  By default the
platform writes its content
under the current working directory when the platform is launched.  Use the
-data parameter to
specify a different content area for the platform.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformMetaArea.createLocation(PlatformMetaArea.java:72)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.setupMetaArea(InternalPlatform.java:878)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderStartup(InternalPlatform.java:559)
	... 8 more

I did see though, that the user is able to define a particular directory, but I
believe it is less error-prone for a multi-user enviroment not to base the
default value on the installation directory of eclipse, but relative to the
particular workspace.
A good suggestion - will be taken into consideration.

Wassim, here is the spec:

When defining the default value for the run-time workspace in the launcher, use 
the parent directory of the design time workspace and append the current 
default name.

causedBy.message: The platform metadata area could not be written: /opt/eclipse/runtime-workspace/.metadata.  By default the platform writes its content under the current working directory when the platform is launched.  Use the -data parameter to specify a different content area for the platform.
